text: kingdom of fools
once upon a time in a kingdom far away
there lived an extremely foolish king
with his equally foolish ministers my
king why don't we make a law that every
time you can't sleep everyone in the
kingdom should sing you a lullaby such a
silly idea
not everyone has a good voice you know
what if the bad singers make it even
more difficult for me to sleep your
highness
the people are complaining that food is
very expensive
only the rich can't afford it oh dear
what do you suggest I suggest we make
all food available for the price of only
one coin splendid idea yes
let's make that law and what do you have
to say my king I would like to say that
you're even greater than other Kings
tell me something I don't know well I
was thinking that you shouldn't rule the
way an ordinary king does so why don't
we change day to night and mad today oh
I really like that idea and soon the law
was made and everyone was most upset for
if they didn't obey the king he would
punish them severely so businesses were
opened during the night and people soon
got used to the new lifestyle everyone
even the animals slept during the day
one afternoon a sage came with his
disciple to the kingdom he was very
shocked to see no one out very strange
it's broad daylight and there isn't
anyone out on the streets
- using could be run I don't know master
but well I could really use some
breakfast right now ah think about
something other than food well yeah they
wandered around until it finally started
to get dark and were extremely surprised
to see the people finally coming out of
their houses were they sleeping all day
what a strange Kingdom he watched as the
people went about their work in a very
normal way full the food stalls are open
master may I go just go already the sage
was more interested in the way the
kingdom was running tell me kind woman
why does this Kingdom run at night in
down sleep my day oh what could I say a
king is a foolish one who makes foolish
laws the sage thought hard about what
the woman had said Master look I got all
these bananas cakes and sandwich is so
cheap everything here no matter what
costs only a single coin let's stay here
another one of the foolish Kings laws I
guess we must leave our only harm will
come our way the sage tried hard to
reason with his disciple who only wanted
to stay for the cheap food very well
stay if you wish but I'm going the
disciple stayed in the kingdom and soon
got used to their ways he ate as much
food as he could and soon became very
fat
Oh amazing
Oh master was so wrong about this place
hope one day a thief went into a house
to steal but as he was escaping the wall
of the house fell badly the brother of
the thief went to the king your highness
I have come to ask for justice my
brother was doing his job when a wall
fell and injured him the wall belongs to
a merchant the merchant was summoned and
he came to the palace very surprised
this man says that it was your wall that
injured his brother is it true it is
making the wall was made during my
father's time it collapsed on the thief
and there was nothing I could do about
it either ways you will be punished as
the wall belongs to you what shouldn't
the person who made the wall be punished
the King thought about this and decided
that the merchant was right he called
for the bricklayer who was now a very
old man was it you who built this
merchants wall if yes then you are
responsible for injuring an innocent man
but I will that was so many years ago
what was that I remember why I didn't
build that wall properly there was this
dancer who was walking up and down near
me and the bells on her feet jingled
which distracted me oh we have finally
found the culprit bring this dancer to
me right now
the poor dancer who was now an old lady
trembled as she was brought in front of
the king you have been brought here to
be punished for distracting this man
with your anklets while he was building
a wall
oh that wall has now fallen an injured a
man who was just doing his job my king
I think you have the wrong person I was
only walking on that path because the
goldsmith I kept visiting for my jewelry
kept giving me excuses 5th this case
just gets more complicated fetch me this
goldsmith here and now the Goldsmith was
brought before the king and was shocked
when he was accused of injuring a man
well don't you think it's wrong what you
have done you will be thrown over a
cliff wait please let me explain
it's true that I made this dancer come
to my house many times but it's only
because I had to make a delivery to a
very restless merchant I couldn't ignore
him could I the King asked who the
merchant was the Goldsmith pointed to
the first merchant himself seize him
no no it was my father who asked for the
wall not me however the king didn't seem
like the merchant would be worthy of
sitting in the huge trolley he ordered a
search to be made and soon the only
person who was suitable enough was the
poor disciple they took him to the Kings
Court where everything was explained to
him he was horrified he started to call
out to the sage master master at that
moment the sage suddenly appeared
everyone was shocked what seems to be
the problem the poor disciple explained
everything and the sage just looked up
and
smiled my king could I be the one to
take my disciples place the disciples
soon understood what his master was up
to no your majesty
throw me I was the first choice what how
dare you go against my wish they both
started quarreling leaving the King
baffled why do you both want to be
thrown over so badly my king you don't
know the cliffs of the West are actually
a very special place if thrown off the
people are greeted by the most powerful
fairies of the hills who grant all your
wishes and provide you with abundant
wealth and power enough to rule the
entire world all but the person must be
thrown off only by another holy person
the king was very surprised he didn't
want these two men to be blessed by the
fairies so he ordered the sage to throw
him and his ministers off the cliff you
think I am foolish to let you walk away
with the cake oh wait it is I will be
thrown off oh and my favorite ministers
too well if that is the order that you
give me your highness the king and his
ministers were later taken to the cliff
and squeezed into the trolley the sage
pushed the trolley and a loud squeak
came from the king as they were rolling
off the cliff and he cried
or change my mind
off the cliff they waited only to land
on a net that was placed by the stage
earlier there they were trapped in the
net like fish out of the sea where are
the ferries there are no wish-granting
ferries
you are indeed a very foolish king for
believing such nonsense the same way you
foolishly ruled the kingdom in the ways
you have all this while anyways I guess
we should go now no wait we made a big
mistake when I was in power I did not
think about the foolish decisions that I
made
we have been indeed very foolish please
save us the King had realised his
mistake and was pulled up to safety by
the sage you are very wise and know how
to rule a kingdom I would like you and
your disciple to be the new rulers of
the kingdom the disciple agreed in an
instant the sage however was a little
hesitant but he too soon agreed the
people of the kingdom rejoiced with the
news of their new rulers and everyone
was happy
the first thing I will do is to end this
silly law and day shall again be day and
night shall be night and so the kingdom
was made right all over again the
disciple had been foolish to ignore the
sages words but he had been saved and
had learned to see a little further than
what was in front of him
[Music]
